intro: Scalesia hopkinsii, commonly known as the Hawaiian silversword, is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its rosette of silver-gray, scale-like leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces a single, tall flowering stalk that can reach up to 3 meters in height, bearing yellow flowers at the top. It thrives in the volcanic soils of Hawaii's high-elevation areas and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of the island's summit regions. Due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution, Scalesia hopkinsii is considered an endemic species with significant ecological and conservation value.
